greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest prime factor of arithmetic derivative of n if it exists, or a(n)=0 for n=1 and n=prime.
link: Floris P. van Doorn and Jasper Mulder, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
mathematica: Table[a[n], {n, 1, 105}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 23 2017, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Jul 23 2003
